#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=4. Experimental Data Expansion
#Text=Using the Response Simulating Interpolation Method
#Text=The mid cross section of ECC link slab is the most disadvantageous position under the loading condition presented in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=.
#Text=Meanwhile , the sample points within the mid cross section are the most intensive .
#Text=Hence it should be a good attempt to investigate the working states of ECC link slabs based on the GSED sum of mid cross sections .

#Text=Importantly , these scattered measured strains in this area need to be expanded into spatially continuous strain data without loss of original information before the detection of structural working state .
#Text=Space interpolation methods ( SIMs ) providing access to the data expansion from limited scattered sample points have been widely used in various subjects .

#Text=SIMs can be grouped into four categories : Global methods ( trend surface analysis and regression models ) , local methods ( natural neighbor and splines ) , geostatistical methods ( simple kriging ) , and mixed methods ( trend surface analysis combined with kriging ) .

#Text=Despite the various assumptions and properties of these SIMs , nearly the general estimation formula is shared : ( 11 ) where r ( j ) is the simulated response value at the interpolated j th point , ωi refers to the weighting function assigned to the i th sample point at which the observed response value is ri , and m represents the total number of sampling points .
#Text=Consequently it is a matter to determine the weighting function ωi .

#Text=Among the various SIMs , the response simulating interpolation method is introduced which makes full use of the important properties of numerical shape function ( NSF ) simulated by a physical model .
#Text=According to the discretization concept and the properties of NSF , the weighting function can be derived by numerical simulation .
#Text=Actually , the numerical simulation generally used for estimating experimental responses can partially reflect the implicit information included in a specific physical model .
#Text=Hence the combination of numerical simulation and interpolation is of adequate accuracy .
#Text=The data expanded by a reliable SIM is deemed to be helpful to the investigation on the working state of ECC link slab .
#Text=The determination of NSF and the estimation of response field ( strains ) are implemented following the procedure :
#Text=Divide the area into a certain amount of suitable elements as shown in
#Text=Figure 5
#Text=.

#Text=Although the shape function of each element is estimated , the simulated strain fields assembled with enough small elements can still reflect the strain characteristics of this area exactly with high order continuity .

#Text=The reason is that the calculation of element stiffness matrices and the assembling of global stiffness equation are based on the virtual displacement principle and the force balance principle , respectively .
#Text=Apply a unit strain at node 1 along the direction at right angle to this area , while the other nodes are fixed along the same direction to restrict rigid body displacement .
#Text=Then , the simulated strain field solved by static finite element analysis represents the shape function N 1 , as shown in
#Text=Figure 6
#Text=.

#Text=And it can be expressed by discrete vector N1 = { N 1 ( 1 ) , N 1 ( 2 ) , … , N 1 ( k ) , … , N 1 ( n ) } , where N 1 ( k ) is the function value at element node k and n is the total node number .
#Text=Other NSFs ( N i ) can be determined in the same way .

#Text=Given the strain value at each measuring point and the corresponding NSF , the strain field of this area denoted by ε = { ε ( 1 ) , ε ( 2 ) , … , ε ( n ) } can be constructed as following , ( 12 ) where m is the number of measured points of strain .

#Text=The constructed strain field conforming to Castigliano ’s theorem is independent of loading paths and linear superposition can be applied to the simulated results with explicit physi-cal meanings .
#Text=Data expansion is implemented with the support of finite element analysis software ( ANSYS ) .
#Text=The models of mid cross sections are created with element Shell 181 for ECC materials and element Beam 188 for reinforcing materials .

#Text=After meshing the cross sections ( 60 times 10 = 600 elements ) , the strain data of each mesh node can be determined following the steps described above and then the corresponding stress can be calculated via constitutive relations .
#Text=Accordingly , the GESD at each node and the E j , norm are obtained .
#Text=Furthermore , the structural response field at a specific loading step can be plotted using the expanded data .
